title: Bridge to Abstract Mathematics
description: Introduction to proof techniques, logic, set theory, functions, relations, and mathematical structures. Prepares students for abstract mathematics.

title: Modern Algebra II
description: This course builds upon the concepts learned in Modern Algebra I, focusing on advanced topics in group theory, ring theory, and field theory. Students will explore topics such as Galois theory, modules, and advanced structural theorems.

title: Real Analysis II
description: This course continues the study of real analysis, focusing on the theory of sequences and series, functions of several variables, and integration. Topics include the rigorous development of concepts such as limits, continuity, and differentiability.

title: Number Theory
description: Prime numbers, divisibility, congruences, Diophantine equations, modular arithmetic, and applications of number theory.

title: Pre-Calculus
description: Study of functions, polynomial and rational expressions, exponential and logarithmic functions, trigonometry, and their applications.

title: Calculus I
description: Limits, continuity, differentiation, applications of derivatives, optimization, and the fundamental theorem of calculus.

title: Calculus II
description: Integration techniques, series, convergence tests, Taylor expansions, and applications to physics and engineering.

title: Linear Algebra
description: Vectors, matrices, determinants, eigenvalues, eigenvectors, vector spaces, linear transformations, and diagonalization.

title: Calculus III
description: Multivariable calculus: partial derivatives, multiple integrals, vector calculus, and applications in physics.

title: Calculus IV
description: Advanced integration techniques, surface integrals, and applications in differential geometry and fluid dynamics.

title: Introduction to Topology I
description: Introduction to topological spaces, open sets, closed sets, continuity, homeomorphisms, and compactness.

title: Topics in Euclidean Geometry
description: Classical topics in Euclidean geometry, including axioms, constructions, and geometric proofs.

title: Real Analysis I
description: Real numbers, sequences, limits, continuity, differentiation, integration, and series in one variable.

title: Modern Algebra I
description: Introduction to groups, rings, fields, and vector spaces. Topics include group theory, ring theory, and elementary field theory.

title: Mathematical Models
description: This course introduces mathematical modeling techniques in a variety of real-world contexts. Topics include dynamic systems, differential equations, optimization, and computational methods for solving models.

title: Single Variable Calculus
description: Differentiation and integration of functions of one variable, with applications.
